name: Autosnort
description: Series of bash shell scripts designed to install a fully functional, fully updated stand-alone snort sensor with an IDS event review console of your choice, on a variety of Linux distributions.

name: Posh-VirusTotal
description: PowerShell interface to VirusTotal.com APIs.

name: censys-python
description: Python wrapper to the Censys REST API.

name: python-dshield
description: Pythonic interface to the Internet Storm Center/DShield API.

name: python-sandboxapi
description: Minimal, consistent Python API for building integrations with malware sandboxes.

name: python-stix2
description: Python APIs for serializing and de-serializing Structured Threat Information eXpression (STIX) JSON content, plus higher-level APIs for common tasks.

name: GPG Sync
description: Centralize and automate OpenPGP public key distribution, revocation, and updates amongst all members of an organization or team.

name: BlackBox
description: Safely store secrets in Git/Mercurial/Subversion by encrypting them "at rest" using GnuPG.

name: Cilium
description: Open source software for transparently securing the network connectivity between application services deployed using Linux container management platforms like Docker and Kubernetes.

name: Clair
description: Static analysis tool to probe for vulnerabilities introduced via application container (e.g., Docker) images.

name: Gauntlt
description: Pentest applications during routine continuous integration build pipelines.

name: Git Secrets
description: Prevents you from committing passwords and other sensitive information to a git repository.

name: Prowler
description: Tool based on AWS-CLI commands for Amazon Web Services account security assessment and hardening.

name: Vault
description: Tool for securely accessing secrets such as API keys, passwords, or certificates through a unified interface.

name: git-crypt
description: Transparent file encryption in git; files which you choose to protect are encrypted when committed, and decrypted when checked out.

name: SonarQube
description: Continuous inspection tool that provides detailed reports during automated testing and alerts on newly introduced security vulnerabilities.

name: CanaryTokens
description: Self-hostable honeytoken generator and reporting dashboard; demo version available at CanaryTokens.org.

name: Endlessh
description: SSH tarpit that slowly sends an endless banner.

name: LaBrea
description: Program that answers ARP requests for unused IP space, creating the appearance of fake machines that answer further requests very slowly in order to slow down scanners, worms, etcetera.

name: Artillery
description: Combination honeypot, filesystem monitor, and alerting system designed to protect Linux and Windows operating systems.

name: chkrootkit
description: Locally checks for signs of a rootkit on GNU/Linux systems.

name: Fail2ban
description: Intrusion prevention software framework that protects computer servers from brute-force attacks.

name: Open Source HIDS SECurity (OSSEC)
description: Fully open source and free, feature-rich, Host-based Instrusion Detection System (HIDS).

name: Rootkit Hunter (rkhunter)
description: POSIX-compliant Bash script that scans a host for various signs of malware.

name: Firejail
description: SUID program that reduces the risk of security breaches by restricting the running environment of untrusted applications using Linux namespaces and seccomp-bpf.

name: aws_ir
description: Automates your incident response with zero security preparedness assumptions.

name: CIRTKit
description: Scriptable Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) toolkit built on Viper.

name: Fast Incident Response (FIR)
description: Cybersecurity incident management platform allowing for easy creation, tracking, and reporting of cybersecurity incidents.

name: TheHive
description: Scalable, free Security Incident Response Platform designed to make life easier for SOCs, CSIRTs, and CERTs, featuring tight integration with MISP.

name: threat_note
description: Web application built by Defense Point Security to allow security researchers the ability to add and retrieve indicators related to their research.

name: AutoMacTC
description: Modular, automated forensic triage collection framework designed to access various forensic artifacts on macOS, parse them, and present them in formats viable for analysis.

name: OSXAuditor
description: Free macOS computer forensics tool.

name: OSXCollector
description: Forensic evidence collection & analysis toolkit for macOS.

name: ir-rescue
description: Windows Batch script and a Unix Bash script to comprehensively collect host forensic data during incident response.

name: Margarita Shotgun
description: Command line utility (that works with or without Amazon EC2 instances) to parallelize remote memory acquisition.

name: CimSweep
description: Suite of CIM/WMI-based tools enabling remote incident response and hunting operations across all versions of Windows.

name: DeepBlueCLI
description: PowerShell module for hunt teaming via Windows Event logs.

name: GRR Rapid Response
description: Incident response framework focused on remote live forensics consisting of a Python agent installed on assets and Python-based server infrastructure enabling analysts to quickly triage attacks and perform analysis remotely.

name: Hunting ELK (HELK)
description: All-in-one Free Software threat hunting stack based on Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kafka, and Kibana with various built-in integrations for analytics including Jupyter Notebook.

name: Mozilla InvestiGator (MIG)
description: Platform to perform investigative surgery on remote endpoints.

name: PSHunt
description: PowerShell module designed to scan remote endpoints for indicators of compromise or survey them for more comprehensive information related to state of those systems.

name: PSRecon
description: PSHunt-like tool for analyzing remote Windows systems that also produces a self-contained HTML report of its findings.

name: PowerForensics
description: All in one PowerShell-based platform to perform live hard disk forensic analysis.

name: rastrea2r
description: Multi-platform tool for triaging suspected IOCs on many endpoints simultaneously and that integrates with antivirus consoles.

name: Redline
description: Freeware endpoint auditing and analysis tool that provides host-based investigative capabilities, offered by FireEye, Inc.

name: Scout2
description: Security tool that lets Amazon Web Services administrators assess their environment's security posture.

name: Bro
description: Powerful network analysis framework focused on security monitoring.

name: ChopShop
description: Framework to aid analysts in the creation and execution of pynids-based decoders and detectors of APT tradecraft.

name: Maltrail
description: Malicious network traffic detection system.

name: Respounder
description: Detects the presence of the Responder LLMNR/NBT-NS/MDNS poisoner on a network.

name: Security Monkey
description: Monitors your AWS and GCP accounts for policy changes and alerts on insecure configurations.

name: Snort
description: Widely-deployed, Free Software IPS capable of real-time packet analysis, traffic logging, and custom rule-based triggers.

name: SpoofSpotter
description: Catch spoofed NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses and alert to an email or log file.

name: Suricata
description: Free, cross-platform, IDS/IPS with on- and off-line analysis modes and deep packet inspection capabilities that is also scriptable with Lua.

name: Wireshark
description: Free and open-source packet analyzer useful for network troubleshooting or forensic netflow analysis.

name: netsniff-ng
description: Free and fast GNU/Linux networking toolkit with numerous utilities such as a connection tracking tool (flowtop), traffic generator (trafgen), and autonomous system (AS) trace route utility (astraceroute).

name: fwknop
description: Protects ports via Single Packet Authorization in your firewall.

name: ssh-audit
description: Simple tool that makes quick recommendations for improving an SSH server's security posture.

name: OPNsense
description: FreeBSD based firewall and routing platform.

name: pfSense
description: Firewall and router FreeBSD distribution.

name: Computer Aided Investigative Environment (CAINE)
description: Italian GNU/Linux live distribution that pre-packages numerous digital forensics and evidence collection tools.

name: Security Onion
description: Free and open source GNU/Linux distribution for intrusion detection, enterprise security monitoring, and log management.

name: APTSimulator
description: Toolset to make a system look as if it was the victim of an APT attack.

name: Atomic Red Team
description: Library of simple, automatable tests to execute for testing security controls.

name: DumpsterFire
description: Modular, menu-driven, cross-platform tool for building repeatable, time-delayed, distributed security events for Blue Team drills and sensor/alert mapping.

name: Metta
description: Automated information security preparedness tool to do adversarial simulation.

name: Network Flight Simulator (flightsim)
description: Utility to generate malicious network traffic and help security teams evaluate security controls and audit their network visibility.

name: RedHunt OS
description: Ubuntu-based Open Virtual Appliance (.ova) preconfigured with several threat emulation tools as well as a defender's toolkit.

name: AlienVault OSSIM
description: Single-server open source SIEM platform featuring asset discovery, asset inventorying, behavioral monitoring, and event correlation, driven by AlienVault Open Threat Exchange (OTX).

name: Prelude SIEM OSS
description: Open source, agentless SIEM with a long history and several commercial variants featuring security event collection, normalization, and alerting from arbitrary log input and numerous popular monitoring tools.

name: Icinga
description: Modular redesign of Nagios with pluggable user interfaces and an expanded set of data connectors, collectors, and reporting tools.

name: Nagios
description: Popular network and service monitoring solution and reporting platform.

name: OpenNMS
description: Free and feature-rich networking monitoring system supporting multiple configurations, a variety of alerting mechanisms (email, XMPP, SMS), and numerous data collection methods (SNMP, HTTP, JDBC, etc).

name: osquery
description: Operating system instrumentation framework for macOS, Windows, and Linux, exposing the OS as a high-performance relational database that can be queried with a SQL-like syntax.

name: Active Directory Control Paths
description: Visualize and graph Active Directory permission configs ("control relations") to audit questions such as "Who can read the CEO's email?" and similar.

name: DATA
description: Credential phish analysis and automation tool that can acccept suspected phishing URLs directly or trigger on observed network traffic containing such a URL.

name: Forager
description: Multi-threaded threat intelligence gathering built with Python3 featuring simple text-based configuration and data storage for ease of use and data portability.

name: GRASSMARLIN
description: Provides IP network situational awareness of industrial control systems (ICS) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) by passively mapping, accounting for, and reporting on your ICS/SCADA network topology and endpoints.

name: MLSec Combine
description: Gather and combine multiple threat intelligence feed sources into one customizable, standardized CSV-based format.

name: Malware Information Sharing Platform and Threat Sharing (MISP)
description: Open source software solution for collecting, storing, distributing and sharing cyber security indicators.

name: ThreatIngestor
description: Extendable tool to extract and aggregate IOCs from threat feeds including Twitter, RSS feeds, or other sources.

name: Unfetter
description: Identifies defensive gaps in security posture by leveraging Mitre's ATT&CK framework.

name: Viper
description: Binary analysis and management framework enabling easy organization of malware and exploit samples.

name: OnionBalance
description: Provides load-balancing while also making Onion services more resilient and reliable by eliminating single points-of-failure.

name: Vanguards
description: Version 3 Onion service guard discovery attack mitigation script (intended for eventual inclusion in Tor core).

name: Certbot
description: Free tool to automate the issuance and renewal of TLS certificates from the LetsEncrypt Root CA with plugins that configure various Web and e-mail server software.

name: MITMEngine
description: Golang library for server-side detection of TLS interception events.

name: OpenVPN
description: Open source, SSL/TLS-based virtual private network (VPN).

name: Tor
description: Censorship circumvention and anonymizing overlay network providing distributed, cryptographically verified name services (.onion domains) to enhance publisher privacy and service availability.

name: macOS Fortress
description: Automated configuration of kernel-level, OS-level, and client-level security features including privatizing proxying and anti-virus scanning for macOS.

name: Stronghold
description: Easily configure macOS security settings from the terminal.

name: HardenTools
description: Utility that disables a number of risky Windows features.

name: NotRuler
description: Detect both client-side rules and VBScript enabled forms used by the Ruler attack tool when attempting to compromise a Microsoft Exchange server.

name: Sigcheck
description: Audit a Windows host's root certificate store against Microsoft's Certificate Trust List (CTL).

name: Sticky Keys Slayer
description: Establishes a Windows RDP session from a list of hostnames and scans for accessibility tools backdoors, alerting if one is discovered.

name: Windows Secure Host Baseline
description: Group Policy objects, compliance checks, and configuration tools that provide an automated and flexible approach for securely deploying and maintaining the latest releases of Windows 10.

name: WMI Monitor
description: Log newly created WMI consumers and processes to the Windows Application event log.
